thread.title: Millionaire rapper Stormzy's door 'destroyed by Met Police' after they 'thought he was burgling his own home'
thread.title_full: Millionaire rapper Stormzy's door 'destroyed by Met Police' after they 'thought he was burgling his own home'

author: Helena Horton
title: Millionaire rapper Stormzy's door 'destroyed by Met Police' after they 'thought he was burgling his own home'
text:
Millionaire rapper Stormzy's door 'destroyed by Met Police' after they 'thought he was burgling his own home' The rapper tweeted about the disturbance Credit: Joel Ryan/Invision/AP/Stormzy  15pm 
S tormzy, a prominent rapper, has accused the Metropolitan Police of assuming he was robbing his own home. 
The grime artist, who has an estimated net worth of £1.5 million, took to Twitter to complain about the alleged ordeal. 
The rapper, whose real name is Michael Omari, wrote: "Woke up to Feds destroying my front door coz apparently I'm a burglar who burgles his own home. @ metpoliceuk need your bank details still". 
Accompanying the tweet was an image of a bashed in door. Woke up to Feds destroying my front door coz apparently I'm a burglar who burgles his own home. @metpoliceuk need your bank details still pic.twitter.com/fGH1fsePHv — 24/02 (@Stormzy1) February 14, 2017 
T he Metropolitan Police has disclosed details of a similar incident to The Telegraph, but says as the force cannot identify identities of people who may have had contact with the police, they can't say whether it was Stormzy or not. 
The force told The Telegraph: "Police were called to an address in West Brompton at 00:55hrs on Tuesday, 14 February to a report of a conspiracy to burgle a ground floor flat, believed to have been vacant. 
"Officers attended and forced entry to the property, and found there to be two lawful occupants inside. 
"Officers remained at the property until it was made secure. Officers have since been in further communication with the complainant." Watch | Nick Grimshaw wants to rap with Stormzy 02:02 
T he Metropolitan Police tweeted the rapper after his complaint, writing: "Hi, if you wish to make a complaint please DM us so we can take some more details. Thanks". 
The rapper , who is yet to release a full album, has just announced a 17-date tour. 
He claims it sold out in four days and is due to release his first album soon, posting details on Twitter. 
The rapper, who was born in Croydon, added more dates after his Brixton show sold out in minutes. 
Despite being yet to release his full debut album, he has been a fixture of the UK grime scene for years. 
A well-known rapper, he spent the night in question at the Elle Style Awards before returning home.
